{ HOUSES IN BALCOMBE
There are two large new houses being built in the village centre.We interviewed Mr.Bob Bridger who is building these houses.He told us that before he could start he had to get planning permission from the local council.Local people could object,and the parish council was consulted.The council insisted that the architect drew plans to fit the surroundings. When this was done the council approved the plans and gave permission to build the houses.Once the plans were passed-the foundations are dug.They are dug one metre deep and outlined with stakes,then it is filled with concrete.The houses are built with thermal blocks and bricks.The house has about 15,000 bricks,they are locally made bricks.
